page.title: 02Housing in N.E.Bolton
page.content: Much of this area is a rural suburb of Bolton.Old houses,some dating from the 16th century are dotted around the area.Hough Fold farmhouse was built in 1615 and has been renovated. In 1958 the two farm cottages were demolished and the land sold to property developers.Hall-ith-Wood was a 16th century Tudor building.Samuel Crompton invented the Mule there and it is now used as a museum. Old stone terraced housing,dating mostly from the 1800's,is found along the main roads eg. Bradshaw Brow.These houses are small with tiny front gardens and many have been renovated.
